New Records: Ireland set up its first T20 win over Pakistan by bowling well and fielding brilliantly.
Key Match Events: Opener Andy Balbirnie anchored the Irish with 77 off 55 balls including 10 boundaries.
Curtis Campher knocked them off with 15 from seven balls.
Fast bowler Craig Young conceded only 27 runs and dug out Babar Azam and Azam Khan in the same over.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland, coming off a 2-1 series loss to Afghanistan, was undeterred.
Captain Paul Stirling said, 'We were happy to chase 180.'
Post-Match Reflections: The second of their three T20s is on Sunday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Irish scored 183-5 in reply to Pakistan's 182-6.
Ireland engineered two run outs, and Campher and Barry McCarthy made two brilliant catches in the deep.
Others: Babar's 43-ball 57 and opener Saim Ayub's 29-ball 45 launched the visitors and Iftikhar Ahmed gave them a boost at the death with an unbeaten 37, including 17 in the last over.
